answers.answer: I am assuming you mean gestational diabetes??? I had it with my son and I was sent to see an endorcrinologist who set me up with scripts for testing supplies and a nurse visit to show me how to do finger sticks and follow the recommended diet plan. After a week or so i went back with numbers in hand (4x's a day needle sticks) and at that point because I had a family history he also prescribed me insulin injections once a day, even though he said my numbers were good (?). He also had me come in once a week for non-stress testing and a few extra ultrasounds to see how big he was getting. I was induced at 39 weeks as he was measuring about 8 pounds, he was born a healthy 7lbs. 14 oz.Now this is the strange part, I am not sure about the one hour test but I know the three hour test should be a fasting test and I didn't fast for it and I tried repeatedly to tell all three docotors that (family, OB and endo) but they wouldn't do the test over simply because I had a family history. Now my sister had it with one and not the other and now here I am I had it (supposedly) with my son and yet with the twins I don't so make sure you follow the instructions for testing and if they don't say anything about fasting make sure you ask because I never did and they never said anything!!
u know.. i didnt fast the first test...i think u are right.. i dont know i guess we will see. i will call my endo tomorrow to see, im very nervous, i dont want to take drugs

the  one hour  and  three hour  glucose  are done  fasting i am   medical  tech and  i run these test on  women all the time.  I  am also expecting my third so i have to  go through it again    . Usually they  will try to  treat GD with   a diet  change and then insulin if need  be all depends on how ur body  reacts to  it all  well good luck to u   also they  do the  one hour  usually and if u  fail that one they will do a three hour at least that is what i have  seen  of in the  field of medicine i  work in  any questions u can  send me  note or something  good luck
Rest assured I was borderline for the one hour test but passed with a decent margin for the three hour test!!

I think that is well above what they are looking for.  Don't get too stressed however.  The three hour test is tolerable.  If you don't pass they'll start you on diet.  If that doesn't work you'll be on insulin.  I have now been on insulin since about 3 1/2 months.  If that is the worst case honestly, it is not so bad.  And this is for the sake of your baby also.Ask any questions you like.
